keyword: We'd love to hear from you if you:
terms:
[

  • Have deep user empathy and are able to understand complex product spaces.

    • ,

  • Are a strong cross-functional collaborator, both within the product development organization and with business functions.

    • ,

  • Have a background in building enterprise SaaS products and monetization strategies.

    • ,

  • Have experience managing PMs, and love creating the environment for a happy, successful team. 

    • ,

  • Are unafraid to do whatever it takes to make your team successful, whether that’s sweating the small details, doing IC work, or going back and forth with execs to find the right way forward.

    • ,

  • Have an affinity for the fast-paced, changing environment of a start-up, a sense of humor and get-it-done personality

    • ]

Figma offers equity to employees, as well a competitive package of additional benefits, including health, dental & vision, retirement with company contribution, parental leave & reproductive or family planning support, mental health & wellness benefits, generous PTO, company recharge days, a learning & development stipend, a work from home stipend, and cell phone reimbursement.  Figma also offers sales incentive pay for most sales roles. Figma’s compensation and benefits are subject to change and may be modified in the future.

• Minimum of 4 years of product management experience in PLG B2B Enterprise Growth.• Proven track record of significantly influencing key product metrics, such as Retention, ARR, and GRR.• Thorough familiarity with experimentation frameworks and analysis of experiment results.• Prior experience in a fast-paced product team.• Outstanding communication, collaboration, organization, and problem-solving skills.• Demonstrated success in leading, motivating, and developing engineering & design team members.• Strong project management skills, including breaking down objectives into key results & initiatives and managing teams to deliver continuous value.• A constant curiosity and user-centric approach, always seeking to understand our market, our users, and our opportunities better.• Bonus: Experience with Looker, Amplitude, and SQL.

[

  • 4+ years of ecosystem PM experience

    • ,

  • Experience working closely with a Partnerships function

    • ,

  • At least some technical background — enough to be able to build a “plugin” within a product’s ecosystem, for example

    • ,

  • Has worked in a pod / squad structure at a startup of our scale or slightly bigger

    • ]

[
  • 3+ years of PM experience building consumer tech products with technical background (prior work in fintech is a plus). 
    • ,
  • You think like an owner and are accountable. You understand the outcomes that the business is trying to achieve and how your work contributes to that. You find ways to drive this outcome by improving our product, processes, and ritual. 
    • ,
  • You are curious and find answers. You talk to users and do market research to gather qualitative evidence that informs your bets.
    • ,
  • You make the right bets. You can balance identifying, prioritizing and executing on a mix of high probability optimization opportunities and higher risk 10x ideas.
    • ,
  • You like to move and learn fast. You do best in small, collaborative, and ambiguous environments. You are excited to work closely with founders and execs. You enjoy turning a blank canvas into a magical product over time. You don’t “boil the ocean”, but think about MVPs and incremental benefits.
    • ,
  • You are fluent with data. You can use data to answer questions, identify product opportunities, find insights from releases, measure progress towards goals, and iterate quickly. (SQL proficiency is a plus)
    • ,
  • You are a good communicator. Whether it is written (product requirements, strategy, launch plans) or verbal (meetings, all hands, user calls) you understand what you need to communicate and how best to do it.
    • ,
  • You make things happen. You are scrappy and find ways to overcome roadblocks with workarounds or tradeoffs.
    • ,
  • You are organized and detail oriented. Balancing multiple projects, deadlines, and requests is second nature to you.
    • ]
